newsitem.title: MEXICO: Powerful Mexican union leader in hospital.
newsitem.headline: Powerful Mexican union leader in hospital.

text.p: Veteran Mexican labour leader Fidel Velazquez, 96, was back in a hospital on Monday after suffering a relapse of an intestinal infection, labour officials said.

Velazquez, the longtime leader of the 6 million strong Mexican Workers Confederation (CTM), was hospitalized on Friday at Mexico City's ABC Hospital and was expected to remain there for about four more days, said Leonardo Rodriguez Alcaine, the acting head of the CTM.

The 96-year-old labour head has run the CTM for more than half a century during which he has been a staunch ally of the ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party. He has no obvious successor at the CTM.
Rodriguez told reporters Velazquez had already recovered from the infection, which had forced him to undergo hospitalization earlier this month, but would remain in hospital to rest.
Velazquez has been hospitalized three times in the past five months and at least four times in the past year.
